description: Comprehensive IOCs for the enc/dec ransomware family, a sophisticated custom-developed ransomware toolkit discovered in a malware development repository. The toolkit employs professional-grade hybrid RSA-2048 + ChaCha20 encryption with custom hand-coded cryptographic implementation featuring AVX-512/AVX2/SSE hardware optimization. Discovered on open directory 109.230.231.37.

indicators: Professional R&D environment with versioned builds and testing utilities

enc_v2_exe.variant: Version 2 encryptor - most comprehensively reverse engineered
capabilities: Custom ChaCha20 implementation with AVX optimization
debug_artifacts: Rust debug paths visible in binary

capabilities: Blocklists: system files/folders to prevent damage
Fast decryption (potentially reduced safety checks for speed)

ransom_note_exec_exe.type: Associated executable - GUI ransom note display utility

distribution_infrastructure.description: enc/dec malware distribution point - open directory serving 38 malicious executables including enc/dec ransomware family, espionage tools (agent.exe, steal_browser.exe), commodity RATs (Xworm), and persistence droppers (FleetAgent family)
distribution_infrastructure.action: BLOCK at network perimeter immediately (all ports, all protocols, inbound AND outbound)

c2_infrastructure.description: No active C2 communication observed during analysis (R&D environment samples, not operational deployment). Associated Xworm variants in enc/dec use 109.230.231.37 for C2.
c2_infrastructure.expected_behavior: Encrypted C2 traffic using RSA, ChaCha20 cryptography
c2_infrastructure.detection_strategy: Monitor for unusual encrypted outbound connections from Rust executables, especially to 109.230.231.37

README_txt.description: Primary ransom note deployed by enc_v2.exe, updated_enc.exe, enc.exe

lockbox.description: Referenced in some enc/dec reports (not directly confirmed in enc/dec samples)
lockbox.note: Encrypted files may preserve original extension or use custom extension

vss_deletion.description: Concatenated VSS deletion commands (unique string artifact)
vss_deletion.impact: Prevents recovery from Volume Shadow Copies
vss_deletion.detection: Monitor for vssadmin.exe or wmic.exe with 'delete shadows' or 'shadowcopy delete' parameters

drive_enumeration.behavior: Enumerate all drive letters A-Z + network shares
drive_enumeration.impact: Identify all accessible storage for encryption
drive_enumeration.detection: Monitor for single process accessing 10+ drive letters within short timeframe

mass_file_modification.behavior: Rapid encryption of thousands of files across multiple directories and drives
mass_file_modification.detection: Monitor for high-volume file modification events from single process

network_share_enumeration.behavior: Enumerate and access network shares for lateral encryption
network_share_enumeration.impact: Encrypt data on network file servers and shared drives
network_share_enumeration.detection: Monitor for network share enumeration followed by mass file modifications

stack_checking_loop.signature: Stack-based anti-debugging loop in C runtime (sub_140001180)
stack_checking_loop.behavior: Continuous stack base monitoring, Sleep(1000ms) on debugger detection
stack_checking_loop.impact: Defeats debugger attachment, evades automated sandboxes
stack_checking_loop.confidence: VERY HIGH - present in ALL analyzed samples

vectored_exception_handling.behavior: Intercept exceptions before debuggers, interfere with breakpoint debugging

sleep_evasion.technique: T1497.003 - Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
sleep_evasion.behavior: Repeated Sleep(1000ms) calls to slow sandbox analysis

high_cpu_usage.description: 80-100% CPU usage during encryption phase (AVX-512/AVX2/SSE optimization)
high_cpu_usage.impact: Very fast encryption speed - minutes to encrypt hundreds of GB
high_cpu_usage.detection: EDR behavioral alert for sustained high CPU from Rust executables

chacha20_constant.description: ChaCha20 initialization constant (RFC 8439) - definitive algorithm identification
chacha20_constant.confidence: CONFIRMED in enc_v2.exe, dec.exe, enc_pervictim.exe, updated_enc.exe

vss_concatenated.description: Unique concatenation of VSS deletion commands

rsa_chacha20_message.description: Console output message confirming cryptographic scheme

chacha20_pervictim_rs.description: Rust source file debug artifact - confirms per-victim key generation

netuse_disks_rs.description: Rust source file debug artifact - network share module

persistence: T1547.001 - Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys (not in ransomware, present in associated FleetAgent tools)
defense_evasion: T1497.003 - Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
other: T1070.004 - Indicator Removal: File Deletion (dec.exe cleanup)
T1489 - Service Stop (potential - service blocklists suggest awareness)
T1112 - Modify Registry (circumstantial - FleetAgent tools use registry)

high_fidelity_indicators: File hash match: Any of the 11 enc/dec variant SHA256 hashes
String match: 'expand 32-byte k' in process memory or file scan
Network connection to 109.230.231.37 (any port, any protocol)
VSS deletion commands: vssadmin.exe or wmic.exe with shadowcopy delete parameters
behavioral_patterns: Rust executable creating persistence mechanisms (associated FleetAgent tools)
Single process accessing 10+ drive letters within short timeframe
Mass file modification: 1000+ files in <1 hour from single process
Network share enumeration followed by mass file modifications
High CPU usage (80-100%) from Rust executable in user directories
Encrypted outbound connections from Rust executables
forensic_artifacts: VSS deletion events in Windows Event Logs
Process creation events for Rust-compiled executables
File modification events showing rapid encryption pattern
yara_rules: EncDec_Rust_Artifacts (very high fidelity - unique debug paths)

key_hierarchy.master_key: Threat actor RSA-2048 private key (offline, attacker-controlled)
key_hierarchy.public_key: Embedded RSA-2048 public key in encryptor executables
key_hierarchy.session_key_protection: Encrypted with RSA public key, stored in file footer

optimization.avx512: 512-bit ZMM registers (16 parallel operations) - 4x faster than SSE
optimization.avx2: 256-bit YMM registers (8 parallel operations) - 2x faster than SSE
optimization.cpu_dispatcher: Runtime CPU feature detection and optimal implementation selection

cryptographic_analysis.cryptographic_strength: Unbreakable without threat actor's master private key
decryption_requirements: Threat actor's master RSA-2048 private key (offline, attacker-controlled)
Without both: Decryption is computationally infeasible
cryptographic_analysis.recovery_path: Offline backup restoration is the only cryptographically-independent recovery method

immediate_actions_0_4_hours: Block 109.230.231.37 at network perimeter (all ports, all protocols, inbound + outbound)
Isolate infected systems from network (preserve power for forensics)
Secure offline backups (verify integrity, create additional copies)
Deploy enc/dec detection signatures (YARA, Sigma, EDR rules)
Execute threat hunting queries (identify all infected systems)
short_term_4_24_hours: Complete threat hunt (final infected system count)
Forensic image acquisition (memory + disk from patient zero)
eradication_days_2_3: Remove enc/dec malware from all systems
Eliminate malware persistence mechanisms (Registry, Scheduled Tasks, LNK files)
System rebuilds (48-72 hours per critical system - servers first)
Credential resets (assume all credentials compromised by espionage tools)
recovery_days_3_7: Phased return to operations (critical → standard → endpoints)
post_incident_week_2_plus: Threat intelligence sharing (IOCs to ISACs, law enforcement)

rationale: No guarantee of decryption tool delivery (industry data: 35% of payers do not receive functional tools)
Payment to sanctioned entities may violate OFAC regulations
recovery_considerations.backup_dependency: enc/dec deletes Volume Shadow Copies - offline backups are ESSENTIAL
recovery_considerations.recovery_path: Restore from pre-infection offline backups (verified and tested)

development_timeline.characteristics: Professional malware development environment with versioned builds and testing utilities
development_timeline.capabilities: Dual-purpose operations (espionage + ransomware), custom cryptographic implementations
development_timeline.sophistication: Custom ChaCha20+RSA implementation with hardware optimization (AVX-512/AVX2/SSE)

dual_threat_assessment.ransomware: Data encryption for financial extortion, operational disruption, recovery costs
dual_threat_assessment.espionage: Repository contains espionage tools likely deployed alongside ransomware - potential for intellectual property theft, credential compromise, long-term persistent access, future repeat attacks

strategic_concerns: Professional development sophistication suggests well-resourced threat actors
Per-victim key generation indicates targeting capability beyond opportunistic attacks
Repeat attack risk if espionage tools remain undetected
Supply chain risk if organization is supplier/partner to higher-value targets

gdpr.breach_notification: 72 hours to supervisory authority if customer data encrypted
gdpr.customer_notification: Without undue delay if high risk to customer rights
gdpr.potential_fines: Up to €20 million or 4% annual global revenue

hipaa.breach_notification: HHS notification within 60 days if PHI encrypted
hipaa.potential_fines: Up to $1.5 million per violation category per year

pci_dss.potential_consequences: Increased transaction fees, loss of card processing ability

state_breach_laws.notification: All 50 US states have breach notification laws
state_breach_laws.credit_monitoring: May be required depending on data types
